page.title: 08The story of William Kempe.
page.content: William Kempe,of Spains Hall wrongly accused his wife so vowed to be silent for 7yrs and dig a fishpond each year. "The Raven",a 7th son of a 7th son prophesied disaster.The 1st year three servants died in the pond.Next year his wife died.The 3rd year he wouldn't call out when thrown from his horse. The last year riding from Halstead, he overheard plans to rob Spains Hall, as he sheltered from a dreadful storm. Stopped by a swollen river,still refusing to speak,he sent his servant with a written message to swim.However the message was washed away and allthe servants not understanding set out to look for William leaving only one small boy to guard the house. The thieves murdered the boy and ransacked the house.Some say William died silent,others that a preacher finally persuaded him to pray.
